text.__SUMMARY__:
Allium caesium, light blue garlic, is a species of herbaceous perennial flowering plant native to central Asia (Xinjiang, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan, Uzbekistan). It grows in deserts and dry fields at elevations of 700–2000 m.Allium caesium produces round bulbs up to 15 mm across. Scapes are up to 65 cm tall. Leaves are round in cross-section, slightly shorter than the scapes. Flowers are sky-blue. The Latin specific epithet caesium means “grey-blue”.In cultivation in the UK, this plant has gained the Royal Horticultural Society’s Award of Garden Merit.
